SCHOOL BOARD VACANCY: The District is currently looking for someone to fill a vacancy on the Board of School Directors. Under the School Code, to be eligible to be elected or appointed to a Pennsylvania school board, one must be a citizen, at least 18 years old, of good moral character, and a resident of the school district for at least one year prior to the date of election or appointment.

To fill this vacancy, the candidate must also live within Region 3 (Fairview Township Precinct 3, Newberry Township Precincts 1 & 3, Goldsboro Borough, Lewisberry Borough).

Construction on our NEW Rossmoyne Elementary School has resumed with additional safety protocols in place. We are very excited to see the new school taking shape, but are sad to share that delays resulting from COVID-19 have pushed completion of the building well beyond the start of the 2020-2021 school year. As a result, students and staff will be starting next school year at our existing schools.

On the bright side, we look forward to having opportunities to say our final goodbyes to the existing school before transitioning to the new space. #WestShoreProud #BuildingForTheFuture

shared_text:
The College Board
March 16 at 2:26 PM ·

The College Board is developing tools to mitigate the impact of school closures on students in the Advanced Placement Program. All AP students and teachers will be able to draw on the free online resources that were provided to every AP classroom this fall. Additional resources will be made easily accessible to AP students and teachers through mobile phones and other devices. These include free online AP lessons and review sessions from some of the top AP teachers in the country.

The AP program is finalizing streamlined AP exam options that would allow students to test at home, depending on the situation in May. We’re working to give every AP student the opportunity to claim the credit they’ve earned. The AP Program will communicate the details of these additional solutions to educators and students by March 20.

The College Board’s focus will remain on student safety and ensuring all students have the tools they need to work, and opportunities to receive the credit they have earned, during this challenging time.

More details: http://spr.ly/61861srPq.

LOOKING AHEAD: Last night the Board adopted a final calendar for next school year. Students will start the 2020-2021 school year on Tuesday, August 25, 2020 and the class of 2021 will graduate on Saturday, June 5, 2021!

We received more than 560 responses to our calendar survey this year. After careful review of the comments, concerns, and questions received, one change to the proposed calendar was made; November 30, will be a non-school day, and in exchange, April 1, will be a student day.

This afternoon, families and staff were emailed additional information regarding this change, answers to frequently asked questions, and a copy of the complete calendar. This information can also be found on our website.

🗓️ http://bit.ly/WestShore20-21

Thank you to each of you who submitted feedback and participated in the calendar development process.
